result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:10 PM Defendant Deontre Tremaine Smith appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Avery L Goodrich Jr. appeared by video for Deontre Tremaine Smith.  Attorney Joel N Urmanski appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Court converted bond to signature bond, but notes bond is unsigned and Deft still in custody.
Deft states he has been revoked.
State agrees that bond was converted, but Deft is being revoked. State notes ATF Agent was not able to release information needed. Believes new Trial dates need to be set and will defer to Atty Goodrich.
DA Urmanski will be reaching out to obtain information from Federal Agent in order to proceed with this case.
Atty Goodrich does not have phone data.
Atty Goodrich and Deft put into breakout room)
(Court goes off record)
2:29pm - Court recalls
Atty Goodrich - given the nature of this case requesting a Final Pretrial and Trial date. 
State is hoping to have a response by next week regarding Federal information and will share with Defense.
State notes this case probably won't be able to be tried until December due to Court's Trial calendar and intake.
Court sets Trial dates.
Witness Lists, Jury Instructions, Motions in Limine to be filed by October 7th.

1:40, 2:01PM Prosecuting attorney Grant D Scaife in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Deontre Tremaine Smith appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Avery L Goodrich Jr. in court for Deontre Tremaine Smith. 
State: no resolution, not ready to proceed to trial. Milwaukee Federal Agents have gun and cell phone data - waiting for it to be released. Defense would like to review all evidence prior to trial. Defendant would like to proceed to trial this week. Court grants State's motion to adjourn. Court converts current cash bond to signature bond with additional conditions: GPS to remain in Sheboygan County and day reporting for UA's.
